skill.name: systematic-debugging
skill.description: Use when encountering any bug, test failure, or unexpected behavior, before proposing fixes
skill.summary: Use when encountering any bug, test failure, or unexpected behavior, before proposing fixes
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill containing only markdown guides and example code patterns. No executable code, network calls, file access, or external command execution in the skill itself. Contains one bash helper script as documentation example only.

content.user_title: Apply systematic debugging before any fix
content.value_statement: Random fixes waste time and create new bugs. This skill provides a four-phase methodology to find root causes before attempting solutions. Complete Phase 1 investigation before proposing any fix.
actual_capabilities: Four-phase debugging process (Root Cause, Pattern Analysis, Hypothesis, Implementation)
Data flow tracing through call stacks to find original triggers
Defense-in-depth validation at multiple system layers
Condition-based waiting patterns to replace arbitrary timeouts
Multi-component system evidence gathering at boundaries
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests automatically
Does not access project files or repositories
Does not perform static analysis or code scanning
Provides methodology guidance only, requires human execution

use_cases.title: Debug production bugs
use_cases.description: Trace root causes through complex codebases before proposing fixes to avoid symptom-only patches

use_cases.title: Fix flaky tests
use_cases.description: Replace arbitrary sleep statements with condition-based waiting for reliable test execution

use_cases.title: Investigate CI failures
use_cases.description: Gather evidence at component boundaries when multi-layer systems fail in deployment pipelines

prompt_templates.title: Quick error check
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the systematic debugging skill. Read the error message carefully, then follow Phase 1 to reproduce the issue and identify the root cause before proposing any fix.

prompt_templates.title: Reproduce bug
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply systematic debugging. What steps reproduce this bug consistently? Trace the data flow backward to find where the invalid value originated. List every component boundary the data passes through.

prompt_templates.title: Compare patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Use systematic debugging Phase 2. Find a working example of this pattern in the codebase. Compare it line by line against the broken code. List every difference you find.

prompt_templates.title: Hypothesis testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply systematic debugging Phase 3. State one clear hypothesis: I think X is the root cause because Y. Make the smallest possible change to test this. If it fails, form a new hypothesis, do not add more fixes.

output_examples.input: Tests are failing with 'undefined is not a function' in the payment module
output: Error Analysis: Check stack trace for line numbers and call stack
Reproduction: Identify exact conditions that trigger the failure
Recent Changes: Review git history for the payment module
Root Cause: Trace backward through the call chain to find where 'undefined' originated
Pattern Analysis: Find similar working code patterns in the codebase
Hypothesis: State single theory, test minimally, iterate if needed

best_practices: Always complete Phase 1 (root cause) before attempting any fix
Make one hypothesis at a time, test minimally, verify before continuing
After three failed fix attempts, question the architecture, do not add more fixes
anti_patterns: Proposing fixes without completing root cause investigation
Adding multiple changes at once to test multiple theories
Skipping the process for issues that seem simple

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Applies to any bug, test failure, or unexpected behavior scenario.

faq.question: What is the time investment for this process?
faq.answer: Systematic debugging takes 5-15 minutes but saves hours of rework. First-time fix rate improves from 40% to 95%.

faq.question: How does this integrate with test-driven development?
faq.answer: Use TDD for creating the failing test case in Phase 4. The skills complement each other: TDD proves the fix, systematic debugging finds the root cause.

faq.question: Is user data accessed during debugging?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based methodology skill. It does not execute code, access files, or read user data.

faq.question: What if the issue cannot be reproduced?
faq.answer: If the issue is not reproducible, gather more diagnostic data rather than guessing. Most 'no root cause' cases are incomplete investigation.

faq.question: How is this different from normal debugging?
faq.answer: Normal debugging often fixes symptoms. Systematic debugging requires finding the original trigger. Fixing symptoms creates new bugs; fixing the source eliminates the problem entirely.
